title: Smoked Fish Spread
summary: Smoked Fish Spread is a gluten free, primal, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe with 6 servings. One serving contains 113 calories, 16g of protein, and 4g of fat. For $3.53 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 2 hours. Head to the store and pick up cream cheese, paprika, pepper, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. It works well as a pretty expensive main course. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 75%. This score is solid. Try Smoked Salmon Spread, Smoked Trout Spread, and Smoked Oyster Spread for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity – making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.

instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Cut the smoked fish into 1in (2.5cm) pieces. Place in a food processor and add the cheese, lemon juice, and horseradish. Pulse until smooth. Season with pepper and more horseradish if you wish. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours.                                                     Transfer to a serving bowl and sprinkle with paprika.                                                    Good with melba toast, toasted slices of whole-grain bread, or chunks of baguette.                                                    Variation:                                                    Smoked Eel Spread: Try making the spread with smoked eel, a traditional Dutch delicacy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Cut the smoked fish into 1in (2.5cm) pieces.

Place in a food processor and add the cheese, lemon juice, and horseradish. Pulse until smooth. Season with pepper and more horseradish if you wish. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour and up to 24 hours.
Transfer to a serving bowl and sprinkle with paprika.
Good with melba toast, toasted slices of whole-grain bread, or chunks of baguette.
Spread: Try making the spread with smoked eel, a traditional Dutch delicacy.
